bug.author: michaelmyc
bug.description: Data loss happens when graphs get updated. A hacky fix is to click the edit button and it may be refreshed. However, this fix does not work when the run is finished. This seems to be more likely when more data is logged. Example: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15188392/97942195-229a6680-1d52-11eb-9292-79377f6e417e.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 1.00. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hey @6etacat , thanks for reporting. We're looking into this.

Hey @6etacat for performance reasons we randomly sample more than 5k data points to 5k data points in the UI. The data is still stored and the full resolution data can be accessed via our api with the method: <denchmark-link:https://docs.wandb.com/library/api/examples#export-metrics-from-a-large-single-run-without-sampling>https://docs.wandb.com/library/api/examples#export-metrics-from-a-large-single-run-without-sampling</denchmark-link>

I'm wondering how I will be able to visualize things normally? This happens to data charts that have very few data points as well. I can't work with a graph like this, and I have no way to make it look normal again. Sure I can extract the data and visualize it with matplotlib or some other tool, but then what's the point of using wandb anymore? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15188392/98151932-f50f0380-1e9e-11eb-86d4-425de55b6717.png></denchmark-link>
Hi @6etacat could you please email <denchmark-link:mailto:vanpelt@wandb.com>vanpelt@wandb.com</denchmark-link> to set up a quick call so we can get this fixed for you
